content.description:
Image 1

FRESCO PAINTED ON THE OUTER WALL OF THE MOLDOVITA MONASTERY IN ROMANIA DEPICTING THE OTTOMAN SIEGE OF CONSTANTINOPLE IN 1453

The monastery was built in 1532.

Image 2

NAKKASH OSMAN, OTTOMAN COURT PAINTER, MINIATURE DEPICTING AN OTTOMAN SIEGE OF A EUROPEAN CITY DURING THE REIGN OF SULTAN SÜLEYMAN I (1520–1566)

The image was produced for an official history of the Ottoman Empire compiled circa 1585.
content.question: In the sixteenth and seventeenth centuries, many states responded to threats of the type depicted in the two images by

choices.label: forcing Muslims within their territories to convert to Christianity
seeking to increase tax revenues and professionalize their militaries
recruiting large numbers of Ottoman military advisors
engaging in economic boycotts against Ottoman trade goods

content.answer: seeking to increase tax revenues and professionalize their militaries
